description: J.W. Meigen describes D. melanogaster
T.H. Morgan reports white mutation and sex-linked inheritance
T.H. Morgan reports phenomenon of crossing over
T.H. Morgan reports existence of sex-linked lethals
A.H. Sturtevant reports first genetic map
A.H. Sturtevant discovers first cross-over suppressing chromosome
H.J. Muller reports number of linkage groups is equal to the number of chromsomes
T.H. Morgan reports lack of crossing over in D. melanogater males
C.B. Bridges proves chromosome theory of heredity
H.J. Muller describes balanced lethal factors
A.H. Sturtevant reports first inversion
H.J. Muller reports X-ray mutagenesis
T.H. Morgan receives Nobel Prize
T.S. Painter reports discovery of polytene chromosomes
First issue of Drosophila Information Service published
Bridges and Brehme publish "The mutants of Drosophila melanogaster"
H.J. Muller receives Nobel Prize
M. Demerec publishes "Biology of Drosophila"
R. Konopka and S. Benzer describe the first behavioral mutant
J. Nusslein-Volhard & E. Weischaus report screen for segmentation mutations
C. O'Kane & W. Gehring describe the enhancer trap technique
A. Brand & N. Perrimon publish the GAL4/UAS technique
E.B. Lewis, C. Nusslein-Volhard, E.F. Wieschaus receive Nobel Prize
T. Lee and L. Luo describe the MARCM technique
Publication of the genome sequence of D. melanogaster
J.A. Hoffmann receives Nobel Prize
